titleStmt.title: Letter, Daniel W. Coxe in Philadelphia, Pa. to Charles Pettit, 1804 Sept. 27

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, Daniel W. Coxe in Philadelphia, Pa. to Charles Pettit, 1804 Sept. 27
bibl.note: Insurance Company of North America Records, 1792 December 1 - 1843 February 18

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: The Insruance Company of No. America hold four notes of wherein two prev. amounting together to $4478 50/100, which all told are between this & the 3d of we turnette, as I have of claim against the office in the case of the ship New York, for Restoration of $2500 has been made (that the neccessary Documents to title the loss and now yes see?) & my Brig Fame winded to the be tint of $15000 in your office, has moreover been certified & sent into Tortola for adjudication till - not before of an acquittal, it will not I presume need is there (circumstances can be deemed improper to ask the Indulgence of a Renewal of my sroter for 60 days, address thats the dicount, Liciniclian Accesor
with protection loss forceable having been frequently granted to others, i trust it will be found convencing to grant the request of
Prest of the Insurance Co of No A
